question: Name the 3 basic tenets of the cell theory:
answer: All organisms are composed of 1 or more cells

question: Name the 3 main parts of a human cell.
answer: The cell is the basic unit of life.

question: Cell/Plasma membrane: NONPOLAR
answer: All cells only arise from pre-existing cells

question: Cytoplasm and cytoplasmic organelles
answer: Hydrophilic region exposed to aqueous environment on with side of membrane. May glycoProteins with attached carbHydrate groups

question: Compare and Contrast Prokaryotic and Eukaryotic cells:
answer: Attach loosely to surfaces of the membrane

question: Ribosome comprised of large and small subunits hold a strand of mRNA so that its codons align with the docking sites on the large subunit
answer: Tight Junctions: strands or rows of proteins linking cells, prevents substances form passing b/t cells (forces material to move through NOT b/t cells) maintains polarity of epithelia. (small intestine: prevent digestive enzymes from moving b/t cells, bladder: prevent urine exiting through urinary wall)

question: Incoming tRNA is charged, and it carries a bound amino acid to the A site in the large subunit
answer: Commonly found in external layer of skin

question: Once docked, it aligns its anticodons with the codons on the mRNA strand and moves to the P site
answer: Gap junctions: form tiny, fluid filled tunnels, provide direct passageway for substances to travel b/t cells (ions b/t cells in cardiac muscle)
